results.definition: an excerpt cut from a newspaper or magazine
the act of penetrating or opening open with a sharp edge
the activity of selecting the scenes to be shown and putting them together to create a film

examples: the cutting of whiskey with water

results.definition: the act of cutting something into parts
examples: his cutting of the cake made a terrible mess

results.definition: a part (sometimes a root or leaf or bud) removed from a plant to propagate a new plant through rooting or grafting
(of speech) harsh or hurtful in tone or character
the act of shortening something by chopping off the ends
painful as if caused by a sharp instrument
removing parts from hard material to create a desired pattern or shape
the division of a deck of cards before dealing
examples: the cutting of the cards soon became a ritual

results.definition: a piece cut off from the main part of something
